00001 /* public domain Simple, Minimalistic JPEG writer - http://jonolick.com
00002  *
00003  * Quick Notes:
00004  *      Based on a javascript jpeg writer
00005  *      JPEG baseline (no JPEG progressive)
00006  *      Supports 1, 3 or 4 component input. (luminance, RGB or RGBX)
00007  *
00008  * Latest revisions:
00009  *      1.53 (2016-07-08) Added support to compile as plain C code.
00010  *      1.52 (2012-22-11) Added support for specifying Luminance, RGB, or RGBA via comp(onents) argument (1, 3 and 4 respectively). 
00011  *      1.51 (2012-19-11) Fixed some warnings
00012  *      1.50 (2012-18-11) MT safe. Simplified. Optimized. Reduced memory requirements. Zero allocations. No namespace polution. Approx 340 lines code.
00013  *      1.10 (2012-16-11) compile fixes, added docs,
00014  *              changed from .h to .cpp (simpler to bootstrap), etc
00015  *      1.00 (2012-02-02) initial release
00016  *
00017  * Basic usage:
00018  *      char *foo = new char[128*128*4]; // 4 component. RGBX format, where X is unused 
00019  *      jo_write_jpg("foo.jpg", foo, 128, 128, 4, 90); // comp can be 1, 3, or 4. Lum, RGB, or RGBX respectively.
00020  *      
00021  * */
00022

00027 // or create jo_jpeg.h, #define JO_JPEG_HEADER_FILE_ONLY, and
00028 // then include jo_jpeg.c from it.
00029 
00030 // Returns false on failure
00031 extern int jo_write_jpg(const char *filename, const void *data, int width, int height, int comp, int quality);

00033 #endif // JO_INCLUDE_JPEG_H

00045 static const unsigned char s_jo_ZigZag[] = { 0,1,5,6,14,15,27,28,2,4,7,13,16,26,29,42,3,8,12,17,25,30,41,43,9,11,18,24,31,40,44,53,10,19,23,32,39,45,52,54,20,22,33,38,46,51,55,60,21,34,37,47,50,56,59,61,35,36,48,49,57,58,62,63 };
00046 
00047 static void jo_writeBits(FILE *fp, int *bitBuf, int *bitCnt, const unsigned short *bs) {
00048         *bitCnt += bs[1];
00049         *bitBuf |= bs[0] << (24 - *bitCnt);
00050         while(*bitCnt >= 8) {
00051                 unsigned char c = (*bitBuf >> 16) & 255;
00052                 putc(c, fp);
00053                 if(c == 255) {
00054                         putc(0, fp);
00055                 }
00056                 *bitBuf <<= 8;
00057                 *bitCnt -= 8;
00058         }
00059 }
00060 
00061 static void jo_DCT(float *d0, float *d1, float *d2, float *d3, float *d4, float *d5, float *d6, float *d7) {
00062         float tmp0 = *d0 + *d7;
00063         float tmp7 = *d0 - *d7;
00064         float tmp1 = *d1 + *d6;
00065         float tmp6 = *d1 - *d6;
00066         float tmp2 = *d2 + *d5;
00067         float tmp5 = *d2 - *d5;
00068         float tmp3 = *d3 + *d4;
00069         float tmp4 = *d3 - *d4;
00070 
00071         // Even part
00072         float tmp10 = tmp0 + tmp3;      // phase 2
00073         float tmp13 = tmp0 - tmp3;
00074         float tmp11 = tmp1 + tmp2;
00075         float tmp12 = tmp1 - tmp2;
00076 
00077         *d0 = tmp10 + tmp11;            // phase 3
00078         *d4 = tmp10 - tmp11;
00079 
00080         float z1 = (tmp12 + tmp13) * 0.707106781f; // c4
00081         *d2 = tmp13 + z1;               // phase 5
00082         *d6 = tmp13 - z1;
00083 
00084         // Odd part
00085         tmp10 = tmp4 + tmp5;            // phase 2
00086         tmp11 = tmp5 + tmp6;
00087         tmp12 = tmp6 + tmp7;
00088 
00089         // The rotator is modified from fig 4-8 to avoid extra negations.
00090         float z5 = (tmp10 - tmp12) * 0.382683433f; // c6
00091         float z2 = tmp10 * 0.541196100f + z5; // c2-c6
00092         float z4 = tmp12 * 1.306562965f + z5; // c2+c6
00093         float z3 = tmp11 * 0.707106781f; // c4
00094 
00095         float z11 = tmp7 + z3;          // phase 5
00096         float z13 = tmp7 - z3;
00097 
00098         *d5 = z13 + z2;                 // phase 6
00099         *d3 = z13 - z2;
00100         *d1 = z11 + z4;
00101         *d7 = z11 - z4;
00102 } 
00103 
00104 static void jo_calcBits(int val, unsigned short bits[2]) {
00105         int tmp1 = val < 0 ? -val : val;
00106         val = val < 0 ? val-1 : val;
00107         bits[1] = 1;
00108         while(tmp1 >>= 1) {
00109                 ++bits[1];
00110         }
00111         bits[0] = val & ((1<<bits[1])-1);
00112 }
00113 
00114 static int jo_processDU(FILE *fp, int *bitBuf, int *bitCnt, float *CDU, float *fdtbl, int DC, const unsigned short HTDC[256][2], const unsigned short HTAC[256][2]) {
00115         const unsigned short EOB[2] = { HTAC[0x00][0], HTAC[0x00][1] };
00116         const unsigned short M16zeroes[2] = { HTAC[0xF0][0], HTAC[0xF0][1] };
00117         int dataOff, i, nrmarker;
00118         
00119         // DCT rows
00120         for(dataOff=0; dataOff<64; dataOff+=8) {
00121                 jo_DCT(&CDU[dataOff], &CDU[dataOff+1], &CDU[dataOff+2], &CDU[dataOff+3], &CDU[dataOff+4], &CDU[dataOff+5], &CDU[dataOff+6], &CDU[dataOff+7]);
00122         }
00123         // DCT columns
00124         for(dataOff=0; dataOff<8; ++dataOff) {
00125                 jo_DCT(&CDU[dataOff], &CDU[dataOff+8], &CDU[dataOff+16], &CDU[dataOff+24], &CDU[dataOff+32], &CDU[dataOff+40], &CDU[dataOff+48], &CDU[dataOff+56]);
00126         }
00127         // Quantize/descale/zigzag the coefficients
00128         int DU[64];
00129         for(i=0; i<64; ++i) {
00130                 float v = CDU[i]*fdtbl[i];
00131                 DU[s_jo_ZigZag[i]] = (int)(v < 0 ? ceilf(v - 0.5f) : floorf(v + 0.5f));
00132         }
00133 
00134         // Encode DC
00135         int diff = DU[0] - DC; 
00136         if (diff == 0) {
00137                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, HTDC[0]);
00138         } else {
00139                 unsigned short bits[2];
00140                 jo_calcBits(diff, bits);
00141                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, HTDC[bits[1]]);
00142                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, bits);
00143         }
00144         // Encode ACs
00145         int end0pos = 63;
00146         for(; (end0pos>0)&&(DU[end0pos]==0); --end0pos) {
00147         }
00148         // end0pos = first element in reverse order !=0
00149         if(end0pos == 0) {
00150                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, EOB);
00151                 return DU[0];
00152         }
00153         for(i = 1; i <= end0pos; ++i) {
00154                 int startpos = i;
00155                 for (; DU[i]==0 && i<=end0pos; ++i) {
00156                 }
00157                 int nrzeroes = i-startpos;
00158                 if ( nrzeroes >= 16 ) {
00159                         int lng = nrzeroes>>4;
00160                         for (nrmarker=1; nrmarker <= lng; ++nrmarker)
00161                                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, M16zeroes);
00162                         nrzeroes &= 15;
00163                 }
00164                 unsigned short bits[2];
00165                 jo_calcBits(DU[i], bits);
00166                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, HTAC[(nrzeroes<<4)+bits[1]]);
00167                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, bits);
00168         }
00169         if(end0pos != 63) {
00170                 jo_writeBits(fp, bitBuf, bitCnt, EOB);
00171         }
00172         return DU[0];
00173 }

00254         quality = quality ? quality : 90;
00255         quality = quality < 1 ? 1 : quality > 100 ? 100 : quality;

00257 
00258         unsigned char YTable[64], UVTable[64];
00259         for(i = 0; i < 64; ++i) {
00260                 int yti = (YQT[i]*quality+50)/100;
00261                 YTable[s_jo_ZigZag[i]] = yti < 1 ? 1 : yti > 255 ? 255 : yti;
00262                 int uvti  = (UVQT[i]*quality+50)/100;
00263                 UVTable[s_jo_ZigZag[i]] = uvti < 1 ? 1 : uvti > 255 ? 255 : uvti;
00264         }
00265 
00266         float fdtbl_Y[64], fdtbl_UV[64];
00267         for(row = 0, k = 0; row < 8; ++row) {
00268                 for(col = 0; col < 8; ++col, ++k) {
00269                         fdtbl_Y[k]  = 1 / (YTable [s_jo_ZigZag[k]] * aasf[row] * aasf[col]);
00270                         fdtbl_UV[k] = 1 / (UVTable[s_jo_ZigZag[k]] * aasf[row] * aasf[col]);
00271                 }
00272         }
00273 
00274         // Write Headers
00275         static const unsigned char head0[] = { 0xFF,0xD8,0xFF,0xE0,0,0x10,'J','F','I','F',0,1,1,0,0,1,0,1,0,0,0xFF,0xDB,0,0x84,0 };
00276         fwrite(head0, sizeof(head0), 1, fp);
00277         fwrite(YTable, sizeof(YTable), 1, fp);
00278         putc(1, fp);
00279         fwrite(UVTable, sizeof(UVTable), 1, fp);
00280         const unsigned char head1[] = { 0xFF,0xC0,0,0x11,8,(unsigned char)(height>>8),(unsigned char)(height&0xFF),(unsigned char)(width>>8),(unsigned char)(width&0xFF),3,1,0x11,0,2,0x11,1,3,0x11,1,0xFF,0xC4,0x01,0xA2,0 };
00281         fwrite(head1, sizeof(head1), 1, fp);
00282         fwrite(std_dc_luminance_nrcodes+1, sizeof(std_dc_luminance_nrcodes)-1, 1, fp);
00283         fwrite(std_dc_luminance_values, sizeof(std_dc_luminance_values), 1, fp);
00284         putc(0x10, fp); // HTYACinfo
00285         fwrite(std_ac_luminance_nrcodes+1, sizeof(std_ac_luminance_nrcodes)-1, 1, fp);
00286         fwrite(std_ac_luminance_values, sizeof(std_ac_luminance_values), 1, fp);
00287         putc(1, fp); // HTUDCinfo
00288         fwrite(std_dc_chrominance_nrcodes+1, sizeof(std_dc_chrominance_nrcodes)-1, 1, fp);
00289         fwrite(std_dc_chrominance_values, sizeof(std_dc_chrominance_values), 1, fp);
00290         putc(0x11, fp); // HTUACinfo
00291         fwrite(std_ac_chrominance_nrcodes+1, sizeof(std_ac_chrominance_nrcodes)-1, 1, fp);
00292         fwrite(std_ac_chrominance_values, sizeof(std_ac_chrominance_values), 1, fp);
00293         static const unsigned char head2[] = { 0xFF,0xDA,0,0xC,3,1,0,2,0x11,3,0x11,0,0x3F,0 };
00294         fwrite(head2, sizeof(head2), 1, fp);
00295 
00296         // Encode 8x8 macroblocks
00297         const unsigned char *imageData = (const unsigned char *)data;
00298         int DCY=0, DCU=0, DCV=0;
00299         int bitBuf=0, bitCnt=0;
00300         int ofsG = comp > 1 ? 1 : 0, ofsB = comp > 1 ? 2 : 0;
00301         for(y = 0; y < height; y += 8) {
00302                 for(x = 0; x < width; x += 8) {
00303                         float YDU[64], UDU[64], VDU[64];
00304                         for(row = y, pos = 0; row < y+8; ++row) {
00305                                 for(col = x; col < x+8; ++col, ++pos) {
00306                                         int p = row*width*comp + col*comp;
00307                                         if(row >= height) {
00308                                                 p -= width*comp*(row+1 - height);
00309                                         }
00310                                         if(col >= width) {
00311                                                 p -= comp*(col+1 - width);
00312                                         }
00313 
00314                                         float r = imageData[p+0], g = imageData[p+ofsG], b = imageData[p+ofsB];
00315                                         YDU[pos]=+0.29900f*r+0.58700f*g+0.11400f*b-128;
00316                                         UDU[pos]=-0.16874f*r-0.33126f*g+0.50000f*b;
00317                                         VDU[pos]=+0.50000f*r-0.41869f*g-0.08131f*b;
00318                                 }
00319                         }
00320 
00321                         DCY = jo_processDU(fp, &bitBuf, &bitCnt, YDU, fdtbl_Y, DCY, YDC_HT, YAC_HT);
00322                         DCU = jo_processDU(fp, &bitBuf, &bitCnt, UDU, fdtbl_UV, DCU, UVDC_HT, UVAC_HT);
00323                         DCV = jo_processDU(fp, &bitBuf, &bitCnt, VDU, fdtbl_UV, DCV, UVDC_HT, UVAC_HT);
00324                 }
00325         }
00326         
00327         // Do the bit alignment of the EOI marker
00328         static const unsigned short fillBits[] = {0x7F, 7};
00329         jo_writeBits(fp, &bitBuf, &bitCnt, fillBits);
00330 
00331         // EOI
00332         putc(0xFF, fp);
00333         putc(0xD9, fp);
00334 
00335         fclose(fp);
00336         return 1;
00337 }
00338 
00339 #endif
